snippet: The Justice Department named the 12 members who will hold meetings around the country to find ways to combat a surge of violence on Indian reservations.
abstract: Special Justice Department task force will hold a series of public meetings around the country to study the scope and impact that exposure to violence has on Native American and Alaska Native children; announcement comes amid surge of violence on many Indian reservations.
lead_paragraph: The Justice Department named the 12 members who will hold meetings around the country to find ways to combat a surge of violence on Indian reservations.

headline.main: Task Force to Study Crime on Indian Reservations
headline.print_headline: Task Force to Study Crime on Indian Reservations
